A lot of twists and deaths. I feel like: The fact that so many people don't like this movie is a travesty. Rian Johnson certainly made some risky decision that\, although I don't necessarily agree with in terms of Star Wars lore\, its history and future\, I was extremely entertained by the movie. It took a second viewing for me to realize how awesome it really was. Definitely not the best\, but a very well-done movie. I can certainly sympathize with some of the disapproval\, but people who don't like it because \"it wasn't what [they were] expecting\" should bite their tongue and think back to when they criticized Force Awakens for being the same as a New Hope. Plus\, this sets up JJ to make Episode IX both better and different. \n\nTLDR: Not the best Star Wars by any means\, but an entertaining change of pace.
